t: Proverbs 9
The Way of Wisdom
Wisdom*pn has built her house; she*ld has hewn her seven pillars.
She*ln has slaughtered her beasts; she has mixed her wine; she*ld has also set her table.
She*ln has sent out her young women to call from*ld the highest places in the town,
“Whoever*ln is simple, let him turn in here!” To*ld him who lacks sense she says,
“Come,*ln eat of my bread and*ld drink of the wine I have mixed.
Leave*ln your simple ways, and live, and*ld walk in the way of insight.”
Whoever*pn corrects a scoffer gets himself abuse, and*ld he who reproves a wicked man incurs injury.
Do*ln not reprove a scoffer, or he will hate you; reprove*ld a wise man, and he will love you.
Give*ln instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser; teach*ld a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of wisdom, and*ld the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.
For*ln by me your days will be multiplied, and*ld years will be added to your life.
If*ln you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if*ld you scoff, you alone will bear it.
The Way of Folly
The*pn woman Folly is loud; she*ld is seductive and knows nothing.
She*ln sits at the door of her house; she*ld takes a seat on the highest places of the town,
calling*ln to those who pass by, who*ld are going straight on their way,
“Whoever*ln is simple, let him turn in here!” And*ld to him who lacks sense she says,
“Stolen*ln water is sweet, and*ld bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
But*ln he does not know that the dead are there, that*ld her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
